column4: GDebi says a .deb I made conflicts with a package I have installed, but said package is not installed!
GDebi says that a .deb I made conflicts with a package I have installed, but said package is not installed
My .deb is supposed to conflict with that package, but for some reason GDebi thinks I have it installed
what are the packages in question?
supertux-data
that is what you are installing?  what is the package that is conflicting?

I made a .deb for the latest SVN version of supertux (named supertux-svn), and I purposely made it conflict with supertux and supertux-data. But GDebi says I have supertux-data installed, when I don't/
hmmm.   what does dpkg say when you use that?
nevermind, I found the problem
I accidentally made it depend on and conflict with supertux-data
I was guessing that it was something like that  :)
are you waiting for pulseaudio to load?  redundent question, but is that what you are doing?
I need to delete the .pulse folder, but not so early that it gets recreated when pulseaudio loads
It's a temporary fix for this bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/pulseaudio/+bug/644644
have you tried an upstart script?
No, I haven't. When would that load?
well, upstart controls everything
on, maybe you could make an upstart script with something like start on started pulseaudio /n exec /bin/sleep 30 /n exec rm the_file
s/on/ok/
if you need syntax help to test that idea, let me know
oh, nother idea, just blank the file and that chattr -i file.  Anyway, gl
I got it to work with a shell script
